Sharon, Replying to Critics, Opens Lebanon War Scars
description: Just as the five-year-old scars from Israel's invasion of Lebanon were starting to heal and just as the bitter memories were beginning to fade, Ariel Sharon has revived the wrenching debate here over who was responsible for Israel's most controversial war.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A listing in the Advertising column of Business Day yesterday incompletely described an appointment by Bozell, Jacobs, Kenyon & Eckhardt.

title: Military Outlay Cut Wins Favor in Poll As a Deficit Tactic
description: A majority of Americans favor cutting military spending over other options to lower national budget deficits, the latest Gallup poll has found.

title: NAVY SAID TO FIND NOVEL MINEHUNTER
description: The United States Navy turned a chartered ship into an improvised minehunter to lead a convoy of warships and tankers on the most dangerous leg of a passage through the Persian Gulf, shipping officials said today.

description: '' I was stubborn in my pursuit of a policy that went astray.'' - President Reagan [ A8:1. ]

title: Advertising; J. Walter Thompson Names Vice Chairman
description: J. Walter Thompson U.S.A. announced that Donald G. Sullivan, 46 years old, has been named vice chairman with responsibility for new business and marketing programs. Mr. Sullivan was executive vice president and general manager of Thompson's Chicago office for the last year. Succeeding him in those jobs will be Alan Webb, 47, who is currently an executive vice president and executive creative director at the Chicago agency. Moving into Mr. Webb's position will be Jack DiGiuseppe, 47, who is senior vice president and group creative director overseeing the Quaker Oats business.

title: No Headline
description: 'Anglo Raj' Furniture for a Country Look

title: Schumer's Term Paper
description: When Representative Charles E. Schumer, Democrat of Brooklyn, learned that so-called term-paper ''mills'' banned by New York State had relocated to New Jersey, he asked his staff to order one of these compositions, which students buy to avoid researching and writing their own.

title: Farmers Agency Asks To Sell Rural Loans
description: The Farmers Home Administration's plans to raise about $1.03 billion by selling loans it has made to rural communities moved forward yesterday when a registration statement was filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: HAVERTY FURNITURE reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Sports People; Tigers Get Alexander
description: The Detroit Tigers acquired Doyle Alexander from the Atlanta Braves yesterday for John Smoltz, a minor league pitcher.

West Coast Air Mishap Tied to Radar Blind Spot
description: A small plane that nearly collided with an airliner may have flown into a blind spot in a radar system and gone unnoticed by controllers, the chief controller at Los Angeles International Airport said today.

Darling Thrives Again as Mets Win
description: More than the customary number of yawns were stifled by players and fans alike. The outfielders staggered under fly balls, blinded by the sun, which they rarely see when it is time to play ball. And most of the hitters looked like Casey at the Bat - in this instance, Casey Candaele - the Expos infielder who was hitless yesterday. Yes, the Expos' mighty Casey also struck out before the game was over.

title: Advertising; Campaign Propels 'La Bamba'
description: BY NOW, most people with even the mildest interest in movies are aware of ''La Bamba,'' the film based on the life of the singer Ritchie Valens.

description: Mayor Koch returned to City Hall yesterday for the first time since suffering a minor stroke last week, saying he would ''relish the time when nobody is going to ask me how I'm feeling.''

description: In his first remarks on the Iran-contra affair since the end of Congressional hearings, President Reagan said tonight that he was ''stubborn in my pursuit of a policy that went astray'' - the weapons sales to Iran in exchange for American hostages in Lebanon.

description: The Yankee players held a meeting in the clubhouse before the game Monday night in Kansas City, and excluded the manager, Lou Piniella, and his coaches from it.

title: BOY MISSING FOR 7 YEARS IS FOUND IN A SHACK
description: A child abducted from his home in California seven years ago has been found living with his father in a secluded shack where he used a bucket for a toilet and a bathtub for a bed, the authorities said.

title: Los Molinos Journal; Shoppers in Spain Now Staying Mainly at the Mall
description: Only a few hundred yards and centuries of tradition separate the older business section in the heart of this picturesque village from a still-incomplete pink-drab shopping mall on the western edge of town.

title: Ortega Flies to Havana To Explain Peace Plan
description: President Daniel Ortega Saavedra flew to Cuba today, saying he wanted to explain the new Central American peace plan to President Fidel Castro and to exchange ideas.

The company also said results in year-ago quarter include two months of distribution operations.

title: Sparring Before First Fight

title: The Lure of a Bargain: Garage and Tag Sales
description: THE scene is familiar: a hand-lettered sign tacked to a telephone pole, cars parked along the roadside, card tables on the lawn heaped with books and china figurines, clothing hanging from a redwood fence. Yes, another garage sale - or lawn sale or porch sale or patio sale. Or it might be a tag sale inside the house. Is there anyone who hasn't been to one, if not held one?

title: Volcker at Work
description: Although Paul A. Volcker is officially a former chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, he is still employed there. At the request of the new chairman, Alan Greenspan, and other board governors, Mr. Volcker has become a consultant to the Federal Reserve for ''a couple of weeks during the transition time,'' said Joseph R. Coyne, the chief spokesman.

title: A.H. Robins Board Backs Merger Pact
description: The A. H. Robins Company, now in Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings, said its board had approved a definitive agreement for its previously announced merger with Rorer Group Inc. The $2.6 billion merger deal is still subject to the approval of the Federal Bankruptcy Court in Richmond, the drug manufacturer said.

title: KEY RATES
SAI GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Policy, Any Way You Slice It
description: The midnight oil burned late Tuesday night and into this morning at the White House as policy debates raged over President Reagan's address to the nation tonight.

title: Critic's Notebook; Thinking the Unthinkable, Doing the Unmusical
description: I TOOK some time off and went to Europe this spring, and let me tell you, when the train pulled into Milan, Italy, I made a beeline for La Scala. What an opera house. I sat at the bar across the street and looked at it for hours.

title: Itel to Buy Unit
description: The Itel Corporation said it had agreed to buy the Evans Transportation Company from Evans Asset Holding Company for about $300 million. Itel said the major secured creditors of Evans - which owns 25,000 rail cars - have agreed to release liens on Evans's rail cars or sell their security interests in the cars to Itel. Itel said the transaction would make its rail unit one of the largest independent lessors of rail cars in the United States. It said financing would come from existing Itel resources and a new line of credit.

title: Jackson vs. Bush?
description: In a Presidential campaign that is showing an unusual taste for debates as a gimmick for attracting attention, the Rev. Jesse Jackson, a Democratic contender, has gone after the leading undeclared Republican contender.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: MOONRISE, MOONSET. By Tadeusz Konwicki. Translated by Richard Lourie. 344 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $19.95.

title: Chile Will Allow the Return Of 21 Banned From Country
description: The military Government has authorized the return of the writer Ariel Dorfman and 20 others who had been banned from the country.

title: Official Denies Drug Charge
description: Mayor Mike Roark of Charleston pleaded not guilty before a United States magistrate today to charges of possessing and distributing cocaine and inducing a witness to lie to a grand jury.

title: Harvard President Reviews Law School Tenure Decision
description: Derek Bok, the president of Harvard University, today outlined his plan to review the case of an assistant professor at Harvard Law School who says she was unfairly denied tenure because of her political views and because she is a woman.

title: Straight Talk on Bork
description: It's time for some straight talk about President Reagan's nomination of Judge Robert Bork to a seat on the Supreme Court.

title: Yields Are Mixed
description: Yields on long-term certificates of deposit rose modestly in the latest week, but money market accounts at banks dropped slightly.

title: Maria Swoboda Dies; Noted Ballet Teacher
description: Maria Swoboda, a noted ballet teacher, died last Thursday at Lakewood (N.J.) Hospital, after a stroke in July. Miss Swoboda, who habitually refused to disclose her age, was believed to be 86.

title: London Gives Lessons in Being Civilized
description: To the Editor:

title: Pretoria Seizes 78 Mine Union Officials
description: Security forces arrested 78 black union officials active in the biggest wage strike in South Africa's history today, charging them with subversion and conspiracy to murder miners who would not join the strike.

title: Kenner Bid Begun
description: New World Entertainment Ltd., the film maker and comic book publisher, said it had begun its $475 million tender offer for Kenner Parker Toys Inc. after a state judge decided late Tuesday to lift a temporary order barring the bid. Last month New World made an unsolicited offer for Kenner Parker that was rejected by the toy maker, which is based in Beverly, Mass. Despite the rejection, New World proceeded to announce a $41-a-share tender offer. Kenner Parker immediately filed suit to stop the bid. Although a Massachusetts state court agreed to impose a temporary restraining order barring the bid, Justice John Forte of the Essex (Mass.) County Superior Court overturned that order late Tuesday.

title: HERS
description: LEAD: IN her stunning memoir of bicultural girlhood, ''The Woman Warrior,'' Maxine Hong Kingston writes, ''There is a Chinese word for the female I - which is 'slave.' Break the women with their own tongues!'' English contains no such dramatic instance of the ways in which language shapes women's reality.

title: PANCHO'S MEXICAN BUFFET reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
YANKEES: CLOSE BUT NO VICTORY
description: The last out of the game seemed to symbolize the entire trip. Wayne Tolleson was sprawled face down near home plate, his head down, his helmet tilted off center, his uniform darkened by dirt. All around him, the Kansas City Royals celebrated.

title: Oil Prices Turn Soft; Drop Seen
description: Tensions in the Middle East are feverish, yet the oil market is calm.

title: Vote Planned On New Rules For Low Units
description: The New York City Board of Estimate is scheduled to vote at today's meeting on new zoning rules aimed at spurring construction of lower and bulkier apartment buildings throughout the city to meet the demand for middle-income housing.

title: English Flavor in Books on Gardening
description: WHEN buying a gardening book it is wise to check the copyright page for country of origin. For a country the size of Alabama, England turns out more gardening writers -not to mention gardens and gardeners - than other larger countries can shake their collaborative sticks at.

description: They will probably never play in that North American pageant presumptuously called the World Series, so the baseball players of Nicaragua wanted to make the most of their chance to play the real Yanquis today.

title: A Happy Birthday for the Bull
description: The Dow Jones industrial average celebrates the fifth birthday of a gigantic bull market today and its top-performing stocks during this period continue to draw praise from analysts.

description: A new treatment appears to slow and may even reverse the destruction of multiple sclerosis in patients in the mild early stages of the disease, research shows.

title: Tribute for Michael Bennett
description: A private memorial tribute to Michael Bennett, the choreographer and director who died on July 2, is to be held Sept. 29 at 3 P.M. at the Shubert Theater. Admission to the tribute, which was originally scheduled for July 27, will be by invitation only, Mr. Bennett's lawyer, John Breglio, said yesterday. ''Due to the limited seating capacity at the Shubert, we have no choice but to do it this way,'' Mr. Breglio said.

title: Manpower Studies Defensive Moves
description: Manpower Inc. said today that it was considering several defensive moves in response to Blue Arrow P.L.C.'s $1.21 billion bid. The steps could include acquiring a smaller company or even merging with another concern. Mitchell S. Fromstein, president and chief executive of Manpower, would not elaborate, but he said that he was exploring all possible options before he meets with the company's board Friday in Milwaukee. He said Manpower would formally respond to the $75-a-share offer after the meeting.
